intro: Chionanthus latifolius, commonly known as the Chinese fringeflower, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its white, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
